div.p: SCUTTLES, in a ship, holes in the decks of a ship, either for air, or as passages to the store-rooms ; also openings in a shipâ€™s side for the admission of air. If, in order to sink a ship, a hole be cut in her bottom, she is said, in nautical language, to be scuttled.
